arrears.translation[0].definitions[0].de: money that you owe someone because you have not made regular payments at the correct time
arrears.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: We’ve got 3 months' arrears to pay.
He was ordered to pay rent arrears of £550.
arrears.translation[1].definitions[0].de: money that is owed because it has not been paid on time
arrears.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Unemployment is the biggest cause of mortgage arrears.
arrears.translation[1].definitions[1].de: if someone is in arrears, or if their payments are in arrears, they are late in paying something that they should pay regularly
arrears.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: One in eight mortgage payers is in arrears.
221,900 mortgages were more than six months in arrears.
Thousands of couples are almost £1000 in arrears.
arrears.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to start to be in arrears
arrears.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: Borrowers couldn’t afford to keep up their payments and so fell into arrears.
arrears.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to receive your wages or payment for a service at the end of a period of time you have worked
arrears.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: You will be paid monthly in arrears.
